definition: the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom)/(usually of a couple) to part from each other

variant of 燕[yan4]

Yan, a vassal state of Zhou in modern Hebei and Liaoning/north Hebei/the four Yan kingdoms of the Sixteen Kingdoms, namely: Former Yan 前燕 (337-370), Later Yan 後燕|后燕 (384-409), Southern Yan 南燕 (398-410), Northern Yan 北燕 (409-436)/surname Yan
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
to fly

sentences.english: In some cases, the relationship might go downhill after having spent a couple of blissful years together.
sentences.chinese: 有时候，融洽生活多年的夫妇也会劳燕分飞。

sentences.english: Ernest Hemingway and Hadley separated. She kept their son.
sentences.chinese: 海明威和哈德丽劳燕分飞，儿子由哈德丽抚养。

sentences.english: But on Friday, the pair announced they were no longer together.
sentences.chinese: 不过在周五，这对夫妻宣布他们劳燕分飞了。

definition: to be estranged
an unhappy couple (formal writing)
(of relatives or friends) to live far apart from each other
lit. to take different roads and urge the horses on (idiom)/fig. to part ways
to love each other
to go separate ways (idiom)/to part ways with sb/Taiwan pr. [ge4 ben1 dong1 xi1]
to become enemies (idiom); to fall out with sb
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
to love each other
(literary) stranger
destined to meet but not fated to be together (idiom)
to moisten with spittle (idiom); sharing meager resources/mutual help in humble circumstances
incompatibility of temperament
love is more solid than gold (idiom)
each goes his own way (idiom); each person has his own life to lead
